availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, barkeeper. Native of Ireland. Married to Jane Black. Father of David Black, and John Black. Married to Elizabeth Eliza King Black in Derry, Ireland, on May 13, 1839. Father of Catherine Black, Joseph Black, William Black, Elizabeth Black, and James Black. Arrived in Philadelphia on the Schooner Pilgrim on September 24, 1820. Owned two enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1830. Hotel keeper in Nelson County in 1850. Barkeeper in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Kentucky, Nelson County. Bardstown, p. 139.
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Kentucky, Nelson County, Northeast Division, p. 34.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 387A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, pp. 184-85.
